description: FRONT GARDENT1 - LIME - FELL TO GROUND LEVEL, GRIND AS MUCH OF STUMP AS POSSIBLE & REPLACE WITH MORE SUITABLE TREE (SPECIES TO BE AGREED WITH COUNCIL PRIOR TO PLANTING)T2 - LIME - FELL TO GROUND LEVEL, GRIND AS MUCH OF STUMP AS POSSIBLE & REPLACE WITH MORE SUITABLE TREE (SPECIES TO BE AGREED WITH COUNCIL PRIOR TO PLANTING)T2 LIME TREE IS DYING. HALF OF THE CROWN HAS DIED & THERE ARE NUMEROUS FUNGAL BRACKETS THROUGHOUT THE TREE (SEE PICS ATTACHED)BOTH TREES ARE TOO LARGE FOR THE GARDENS THAT THEY HAVE BEEN PLANTED IN.  RICHMOND TREE OFFICER CONFIRMED IN 2012 THAT THESE TREES SHOULD NEVER HAVE BEEN PLANTED IN THESE GARDENS AS THE SPECIES IS UNSUITABLE AND GAVE CONSENT FOR BOTH TREES TO BE REMOVED AND REPLACED WITH MORE SUITABLE SPECIES (SEE ATTACHED)HOMEOWNER IS HAPPY TO PLANT MORE SUITABLE REPLACEMENT TREES (SPECIES TO BE AGREED BY COUNCIL PRIOR TO PLANTING)LOOKING THROUGH THE PLANNING APPLICATIONS VISIBLE ON YOUR WEBSITE CONSENT HAS PREVIOUSLY BEEN GRANTED TO FELL THE LIME TREES OS 10, 12, 13 & 17 AND PLANT WITH MORE SUITABLE SPECIES AS WELL AS PREVIOUS CONSENT GRANTED TO REMOVE THESE 2 TREES.
application_type_full: Tree works: Trees in conservation areas/subject to TPOs
